meanings.definition: A sensory organ or structure on an insect or other invertebrate.
meanings.sent1: The sensillae on the ant's antennae help it detect food and danger.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the sensillae of bees to understand how they perceive their environment.
meanings.sent3: The sensillae on the spider's legs must be like having super-sensitive fingers!
meanings.sent4: The sensillae of the butterfly are like tiny antennas, picking up signals from the world around.
meanings.sent5: The sensillae of the mosquito are so sensitive, they can detect a human from far away.

meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the sensillae under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The sensillae of various insects differ in shape and function.
meanings.sent3: The sensillae in the collection looked like a forest of tiny trees.
meanings.sent4: The sensillae of the beetles shimmered in the sunlight like a field of diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The sensillae of the caterpillars were so numerous, they covered every inch of their bodies.
